meanings.definition: The act of wandering or roaming without a fixed destination.
meanings.sent1: Her vagabondages through the forest led her to discover hidden treasures.
meanings.sent2: The children's vagabondages in the park brought them joy and excitement.
meanings.sent3: The cat's vagabondages around the neighborhood often resulted in unexpected encounters.
meanings.sent4: His mind's vagabondages into the realm of imagination knew no bounds.
meanings.sent5: The vagabondages of the river as it meandered through the valley were mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: A series of adventures or escapades.
meanings.sent1: Their vagabondages across the country were filled with thrilling experiences.
meanings.sent2: The book narrated the vagabondages of a daring pirate on the high seas.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's vagabondages in the garden turned into a playful game of hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: The vagabondages of the imagination can take us to magical realms beyond reality.
meanings.sent5: The vagabondages of the brave knight in search of the elusive dragon captivated the villagers.

meanings.definition: The lifestyle of a person who travels from place to place without a permanent home.
meanings.sent1: His vagabondages across continents allowed him to experience diverse cultures.
meanings.sent2: The artist embraced a vagabondages lifestyle, finding inspiration in every corner of the world.
meanings.sent3: The vagabondages of the nomadic tribe were guided by the changing seasons.
meanings.sent4: In the vagabondages of life, she found freedom in not being tied down to one place.
meanings.sent5: The vagabondages of the wandering minstrel enchanted audiences far and wide.
